thread.title: ‘Deadpool 2’ Review: Sending Up Superheroism Once Again

author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Deadpool 2’ Review: Sending Up Superheroism Once Again
text:
‘It felt longer than it was, but not in a bad way,” someone said on the way out of a screening of “Deadpool 2.” It felt longer than it was to me too, but in a surreal way that has nothing to do with plot, of which there’s only a scribbly trace, or characters, whose cumulative impact is vanishingly small. In fact, the most satisfying character on the X-Force, the hero’s ragtag team, is Vanisher, a mutant whose special power is invisibility. You never see him—well, almost never—so you don’t have to worry about making sense of what he does.
Not...
